Examples of digital competencies in the context of play and creativeness

Digital Safety

  • Understand the mechanisms of digital identification for learners and the protocols for saving their work securely.
  • Recognise and manage content that may be overly emotional or sensitive.

Digital Work

  • Identify the necessary digital information sources for effective learning.
  • Enable learners to create various forms of digital content, including notes, writings, visuals, and audio.
  • Gain proficiency in user interface (UI) navigation from the learnerâ€™s perspective, emphasizing the key steps to becoming comfortable with the technology.

AI & Analytics

  • Confirm if the educational solution provides automated or AI-driven data collection, along with an interface for monitoring the data.
  • Ensure that learners have the ability to view and track their own data.

Accessibility & Inclusion

  • Verify that the digital tools offer accessibility features that support focus, visual assistance, auditory support, and so on.
  • Guarantee that every learner has an equal opportunity to both engage with and enjoy the creative process.
